alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Central; Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe, central Baldwin, east central Clarke, Escambia, Conecuh, western Okaloosa, Santa Rosa and Escambia Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles west of Monroeville to 7 miles east of I65 And AL 113 to 9 miles southeast of Castleberry to 14 miles northeast of Brewton. Movement was south at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ferry Pass, Ensley, Gonzalez, Bay Minette, Atmore, Pace, Milton, Monroeville, Brewton, Evergreen, Century, Flomaton, Bagdad, Frisco City, McCullough, Peterman, Stapleton, East Brewton, Uriah and Molino. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Central; Baldwin Inland; Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe
